update.description:
This PR provides a world statistics component along with proper sim time, real time, and real-time factor computation. Also added \`mutable\` accessors to EntityComponentManager that provide non-const component access.

A couple bugs have been fixed along the way:

1. Remove the use of `std::any`, which was causing an extra copy.
2. Use `noexcept` to prevent an extra copy.

## A simple test

**Terminal 1**

./bin/ign-gazebo -f ../test/worlds/shapes.sdf

**Terminal 2**

ign-topic -e -t /world/default/stats
update.title: World stats system

content.raw: Let's get this in for the other changes to components and address this comment as we go.
content.html: Let's get this in for the other changes to components and address this comment as we go.

content.raw: I’m still okay with merging as is, but this could be a future enhancement.
content.html: I’m still okay with merging as is, but this could be a future enhancement.

I think that if you use a different cast, it actually won’t perform the copy. Here’s a scratch to demonstrate:

https://godbolt.org/z/bJQarj

The emitted assembly from the second and third variants don’t use the copy constructor.

const TestStruct& t1 = std::any_cast<TestStruct>(var);
const TestStruct& t2 = std::any_cast<TestStruct&>(var);
TestStruct* t3 = std::any_cast<TestStruct>(&var);

content.raw: I think this looks good, it's unfortunte that `std::any` introduces another copy, because I feel like it's more expresssive than `void *`.
content.html: I think this looks good, it's unfortunte that std::any introduces another copy, because I feel like it's more expresssive than void *.

content.raw:
After talking today to @carromj, @azeey and @scpeters, I'm now leaning towards moving time management to the server. The physics system wouldn't be setting time, but being stepped according to the server's time-step. All other systems, such as sensors, would also get precise time information.

So since the query logic is going away (pull request #22), the world component may become different and time will be managed differently, I propose we decline this PR.
content.html:
After talking today to @carromj, @azeey and @scpeters, I'm now leaning towards moving time management to the server. The physics system wouldn't be setting time, but being stepped according to the server's time-step. All other systems, such as sensors, would also get precise time information.

So since the query logic is going away (pull request #22), the world component may become different and time will be managed differently, I propose we decline this PR.

content.raw: Yup, that is all I want to lock for now.
content.html: Yup, that is all I want to lock for now.

content.raw: Could be. This will be fixed in another pull request.
content.html: Could be. This will be fixed in another pull request.

content.raw: There are some tests I added on branch [systems_pr_louise](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/branches/compare/systems_pr_louise%0Dworld_stats_system#diff) that are commented out because they're failing. These were written back when reviewing pull request #10.

content.raw: What happens if two systems try to update time? I remember having this discussion when we were implementing `gazebo_experimental` and the conclusion was that time would be a "global" property managed outside systems.
content.html: What happens if two systems try to update time? I remember having this discussion when we were implementing gazebo_experimental and the conclusion was that time would be a "global" property managed outside systems.

content.raw: If this system requires world components, I think we should include this component on the query and then we don't need this check.
content.html: If this system requires world components, I think we should include this component on the query and then we don't need this check.

content.raw: It looks like all the world component has (for now) is a name. How about making a `NameComponent` instead, which will be present on all (most?) entities, such as models, links, collisions...? Or something more generic like `IdentificationComponent`, which may include a name, namespace, etc.
content.html: It looks like all the world component has (for now) is a name. How about making a NameComponent instead, which will be present on all (most?) entities, such as models, links, collisions...? Or something more generic like IdentificationComponent, which may include a name, namespace, etc.

content.raw: Should this be a double? Should 0.5Hz be a valid rate?
content.html: Should this be a double? Should 0.5Hz be a valid rate?

content.raw: This is only locking `AddQuery` for now. Do you want to also lock other functions like `CreateEntity`and `EraseEntities`?
content.html: This is only locking AddQuery for now. Do you want to also lock other functions like CreateEntityand EraseEntities?

content.raw: This is not implemented, and it shouldn't be const
content.html: This is not implemented, and it shouldn't be const

content.raw: What's the difference between `WorldComponent` and `WorldStatisticsComponent`?
content.html: What's the difference between WorldComponent and WorldStatisticsComponent?

content.raw: Mind updating this documentation? I'm looking through the code trying to understand why one class is called an **Entity**Query and the other is a **System**QueryResponse, it would be great if the documentation would shed some light onto that.
content.html: Mind updating this documentation? I'm looking through the code trying to understand why one class is called an EntityQuery and the other is a SystemQueryResponse, it would be great if the documentation would shed some light onto that.
